data:
1
00:00:44,900 --> 00:00:48,320
People once believed
that when someone dies...

2
00:00:48,400 --> 00:00:52,700
a crow carries their soul
to the land of the dead.

3
00:00:52,780 --> 00:00:56,120
But sometimes,
something so bad happens...

4
00:00:56,200 --> 00:01:01,450
that a terrible sadness is carried
with it and the soul can't rest.

5
00:01:01,540 --> 00:01:04,580
Then sometimes,
just sometimes...

6
00:01:04,670 --> 00:01:09,670
the crow can bring that soul back
to put the wrong things right.

7
00:01:52,760 --> 00:01:55,260
Over here.

8
00:01:55,340 --> 00:01:59,350
There's a piece of glass.

9
00:01:59,430 --> 00:02:01,560
Hey, Sarge!

10
00:02:01,600 --> 00:02:03,850
Yeah?

11
00:02:03,930 --> 00:02:08,440
Shelly Webster and Eric Draven.
Wedding was tomorrow night.

12
00:02:08,520 --> 00:02:11,770
Who the fuck gets married
on Halloween anyhow?

13
00:02:11,860 --> 00:02:13,780
Nobody.

14
00:02:15,360 --> 00:02:19,320
- Sir, we gotta move her.
- Do it.

15
00:02:19,410 --> 00:02:21,660
All right, guys,
let's do it.

16
00:02:21,740 --> 00:02:24,950
Devil's fucking Night.
What's the count so far?

17
00:02:25,040 --> 00:02:26,410
143 fires.

18
00:02:26,460 --> 00:02:29,290
- They're slacking off from last year.
- Three hours to go.

19
00:02:29,380 --> 00:02:34,260
- Maybe they're just slow starters.
- Coming through!

20
00:02:37,220 --> 00:02:40,550
You guys can't come in here
and take her away like this.

21
00:02:40,640 --> 00:02:45,430
There are procedures. You should have
cleared this with me first.

22
00:02:45,520 --> 00:02:47,810
- Is this the victim?
- No, it's Amelia Earhart.

23
00:02:47,850 --> 00:02:50,730
- We found her, and you missed it.
- I don't care what her name is.

24
00:02:50,810 --> 00:02:53,400
I didn't give the order to move her.
Jesus, Albrecht.

25
00:02:53,480 --> 00:02:56,940
I can see why they took away
your gold shield.

26
00:02:57,030 --> 00:03:00,030
Yeah, I wasn't a big enough asshole.
Come on. Let's go.

27
00:03:00,110 --> 00:03:02,030
All right, clear out.

28
00:03:03,410 --> 00:03:06,000
- Shelly?
- Stand back, kid.

29
00:03:08,250 --> 00:03:12,460
- Where's Eric?
- Just don't worry about him.

30
00:03:12,540 --> 00:03:14,750
Tell him to take care
of Sarah.

31
00:03:14,840 --> 00:03:18,760
Look, I will.
You just, uh, lie back. Come on.

32
00:03:28,770 --> 00:03:31,600
- You Sarah?
- Yeah.

33
00:03:31,690 --> 00:03:35,730
Yeah, look. Your sister,
she's gonna be okay.

34
00:03:35,780 --> 00:03:39,070
She's not my sister.
Shelly just takes care of me.

35
00:03:39,110 --> 00:03:41,450
She's my friend.

36
00:03:41,530 --> 00:03:45,450
Her and Eric.

37
00:03:45,490 --> 00:03:47,750
You lied to her about Eric.

38
00:03:47,830 --> 00:03:49,410
I had to.

39
00:03:49,500 --> 00:03:53,210
And you're lying
to me about Shelly.

40
00:03:53,290 --> 00:03:55,630
She's gonna die,
isn't she?

41
00:03:55,670 --> 00:04:00,300
Hey, uh...

42
00:04:04,680 --> 00:04:10,390
Now, come on.
Come on. It's okay.

43
00:04:10,520 --> 00:04:13,940
She's gonna be fine.

44
00:04:32,830 --> 00:04:36,880
A building gets torch ed.
All that is left is ashes.

45
00:04:36,960 --> 00:04:39,840
I used to think that was true
about everything...

46
00:04:39,920 --> 00:04:44,340
families, friends, feelings.

47
00:04:44,390 --> 00:04:48,350
But now I know that sometimes,
if love proves real...

48
00:04:48,390 --> 00:04:52,770
two people who are meant to be together,
nothing can keep them apart.

49
00:05:18,590 --> 00:05:21,590
Later.

50
00:05:31,020 --> 00:05:34,230
What are you,
like the night watchman?

51
00:05:55,540 --> 00:05:58,920
You know, what this place
needs is a...

52
00:05:59,000 --> 00:06:01,340
good natural catastrophe.

53
00:06:01,420 --> 00:06:05,840
- Earthquake, tornado, you know.
- No, no, no, no.

54
00:06:05,880 --> 00:06:08,890
Mickey, come on, man. You got to put
the mustard underneath first.

55
00:06:08,970 --> 00:06:11,260
Maybe a flood like in the Bible.

56
00:06:11,350 --> 00:06:14,390
Hey, hey, let me do it.

57
00:06:14,480 --> 00:06:18,520
There we go. All right.
How about some onions?

58
00:06:18,560 --> 00:06:21,020
Come on, man.
Don't cheap out on me.

59
00:06:21,070 --> 00:06:23,030
- Lots of onions.
- All right, here you go.

60
00:06:23,070 --> 00:06:25,490
Hey, all right.

61
00:06:25,570 --> 00:06:27,950
Now we're talking.

62
00:06:28,030 --> 00:06:32,740
Hey, it's the Sarah monster.

63
00:06:32,830 --> 00:06:36,660
- How do you steer that on a wet street?
- Pure talent. Hi.

64
00:06:36,750 --> 00:06:40,670
Now, Sarah, she's a genuine hot dogger.
You hungry?

65
00:06:40,750 --> 00:06:42,550
- You buying?
- I'm buying.

66
00:06:42,630 --> 00:06:46,300
- No onions though, okay?
- No onions?

67
00:06:46,380 --> 00:06:49,590
They make you fart big time.

68
00:06:55,930 --> 00:06:58,640
You know, Lake Erie
actually caught on fire once...

69
00:06:58,730 --> 00:07:01,360
from all the crap
floating around in it.

70
00:07:02,520 --> 00:07:06,280
I wish I could have seen that.

71
00:08:06,590 --> 00:08:11,090
Fire it up! Yeah!

72
00:08:50,210 --> 00:08:54,140
- All right, we busted their machines!
- Shit!

73
00:09:17,120 --> 00:09:20,490
Oh, oh, shit, guys.
T- bird, cop car, cop car.

74
00:09:27,750 --> 00:09:30,340
Bad people out
on the street tonight.

75
00:09:36,390 --> 00:09:38,300
- Damn it!
- What was that?

76
00:09:38,390 --> 00:09:41,060
- You wait right here.
- Be careful.

77
00:09:41,140 --> 00:09:44,440
Mickey, call it in for me!

78
00:11:05,060 --> 00:11:08,140
Gabriel!

79
00:11:18,360 --> 00:11:21,450
- Eric?
- Department of Housing!

80
00:11:21,530 --> 00:11:26,040
Code violations?
Safety hazards?

81
00:11:26,120 --> 00:11:28,330
Place looks fine to me.

82
00:11:28,370 --> 00:11:31,210
Let's redecorate.

83
00:11:33,710 --> 00:11:37,880
"Abash, the devil stood...

84
00:11:37,920 --> 00:11:40,630
and felt how awful
goodness is.

85
00:11:40,720 --> 00:11:45,310
Saw virtue in her shape, how lovely. "
It's pornography.

86
00:11:46,430 --> 00:11:50,310
Virtue?

87
00:11:50,390 --> 00:11:53,360
Shelly?

88
00:11:55,320 --> 00:11:58,400
- No! Eric!
- See ya!

89
00:11:58,440 --> 00:12:01,200
No, no, no, me first.

90
00:12:03,240 --> 00:12:05,490
Please.

91
00:12:07,120 --> 00:12:09,660
- Shelly.
- Eric!

92
00:12:49,000 --> 00:12:51,910
- Hey, that's good.
- That's good.

93
00:12:55,790 --> 00:12:59,380
See if you can top that, man.
Can you top that?

94
00:12:59,460 --> 00:13:01,380
Look at that.
Look at that.

95
00:13:02,720 --> 00:13:07,180
Here's to Devil's Night,
my new favorite holiday.

96
00:13:10,850 --> 00:13:12,850
You go over there
and talk to your pals...

97
00:13:12,890 --> 00:13:16,020
You sick fuck.

98
00:13:16,060 --> 00:13:19,780
Are you out of
your motherfucking mind, man?

99
00:13:23,030 --> 00:13:27,410
Look at that!

100
00:13:29,620 --> 00:13:31,660
Pussies drink last, man.

101
00:13:32,910 --> 00:13:35,330
- Fuck you, Tin Tin.
- Hey.

102

Shit ain't
even loaded, man.

103
00:13:39,340 --> 00:13:41,510
This one is.

104
00:13:41,590 --> 00:13:44,510
Which of you Motor City
motherfuckers...

105
00:13:44,590 --> 00:13:48,890
wants to bet me
this one isn't?

106
00:13:48,970 --> 00:13:52,850
Hey, fire it up!
Fire it up!

107
00:13:52,930 --> 00:13:56,020
- Fire it up! - Fire
it up! - Fire it up!

108
00:13:56,100 --> 00:13:58,900
Fire it up! Fire it up!

109
00:13:58,980 --> 00:14:02,070
Here's your shooters.

110
00:14:02,150 --> 00:14:04,110

- How ya doing?

111
00:14:04,200 --> 00:14:07,870
Pussycat.

112
00:14:27,970 --> 00:14:31,510
Boo.

113
00:14:39,520 --> 00:14:43,030
- I love you.
- Say that again.

114
00:14:43,110 --> 00:14:45,360
I love you.

115
00:14:45,440 --> 00:14:48,610
Oh, boy.

116
00:14:48,700 --> 00:14:52,120
Restaurant.

117
00:14:56,790 --> 00:14:59,960
- Wow, you look great.
- Ta-da!

118
00:15:03,130 --> 00:15:06,970
Yeah!

119
00:15:07,010 --> 00:15:09,590
- Come here!
- No, no, no!

120
00:16:47,730 --> 00:16:50,280
Couple more rings.
That's 24k.

121
00:16:50,360 --> 00:16:54,370
24k, huh? It's 18k.
It's crap. It's probably fake.

122
00:16:54,450 --> 00:16:56,780
Leather purse. Leather.

123
00:16:56,870 --> 00:17:01,370
Geez. Oh, what is this, Tin Tin?

124
00:17:01,460 --> 00:17:06,000
A blood stain
that's on here?

125
00:17:06,090 --> 00:17:08,710
I'll give you 50 bucks.
And I hate charities.

126
00:17:08,800 --> 00:17:11,630
Now, you,
take it or leave it.

127
00:17:11,720 --> 00:17:14,470
Right there for ya.

128
00:17:14,550 --> 00:17:18,930
Decisions, decisions.

129
00:17:20,470 --> 00:17:23,640
You cheap ass, chrome dome...

130
00:17:23,730 --> 00:17:26,730

saprophyte motherfucker.

131
00:17:26,770 --> 00:17:29,150
Close the gate

132
00:17:29,230 --> 00:17:31,900
Oh, I close this up

133
00:17:31,940 --> 00:17:34,490
Fuck you.

134
00:17:34,570 --> 00:17:37,990
Yeah, sit on it and twirl,

135

Lucky I didn't stab

136

What the fuck you all painted

137
00:19:37,950 --> 00:19:42,200
Halloween ain't till manana.

138

Come on.

139
00:20:24,200 --> 00:20:27,620
Fuck, you murderer!

140

141

142
00:20:34,590 --> 00:20:38,010
A man and a woman

143
00:20:38,050 --> 00:20:40,630

144

145
00:20:45,640 --> 00:20:50,600
Yeah, yeah, Halloween, yeah.
Some dude, some bitch, whatever, man.

146
00:20:50,640 --> 00:20:53,100

147
00:20:53,190 --> 00:20:56,190
You cut her.
You raped her.

148
00:20:56,270 --> 00:21:02,070
Shelly, yeah, yeah. I shanked

149

Murderer? Murderer? Let me tell you

150
00:21:16,290 --> 00:21:20,920
It's easy.
You gonna learn all about it.

151

152
00:21:28,260 --> 00:21:30,930

153

154
00:21:41,530 --> 00:21:43,610

- Aaah!

155

Aren't we all?

156

- It's a mess.

157
00:22:29,990 --> 00:22:32,750

Report from the front.

158
00:22:37,500 --> 00:22:40,800
Get out of my way,
you worms!

159
00:22:41,920 --> 00:22:43,840
Give me some of that

160
00:22:46,090 --> 00:22:49,800
Why don't you ladies come by later?
Check me out.

161
00:22:49,850 --> 00:22:54,640
Hey, guess what?
Arcade Games fell down, went boom.

162
00:22:54,680 --> 00:22:58,520
- Boom.
- Can you imagine that? It's tragic.

163
00:22:58,600 --> 00:23:02,820
Gather your soldiers.
You're on for tomorrow night. No sweat.

164
00:23:02,860 --> 00:23:06,950

- He's taking a meeting.

165
00:23:36,980 --> 00:23:40,770

about the past.

166

167
00:23:45,650 --> 00:23:49,820

168
00:23:49,910 --> 00:23:54,580
He said childhood's over
the moment you know you're gonna die.

169

170

I think we broke her.

171
00:24:23,400 --> 00:24:25,520
I love her eyes.

172
00:24:26,570 --> 00:24:28,530
Pretty.

173
00:24:45,130 --> 00:24:48,300
Hey, kid,
get the hell outta the road!

174
00:25:06,900 --> 00:25:12,450
I told you to stay out of here.

175
00:25:12,490 --> 00:25:16,160
So I guess you're not gonna be home
till a lot later, huh, Darla?

176
00:25:16,240 --> 00:25:20,290
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

177
00:25:20,330 --> 00:25:22,670
I don't have any dolls.

178
00:25:22,750 --> 00:25:26,130
Get some food, huh?

179
00:25:26,170 --> 00:25:29,170
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

180
00:25:34,890 --> 00:25:38,560
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police. "

181
00:25:48,570 --> 00:25:51,820
Thirty, forty dollars.

182
00:25:53,570 --> 00:25:56,030
Who the fuck is this now?

183
00:25:56,070 --> 00:26:00,240
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

184
00:26:00,330 --> 00:26:03,000
Cerrado!

185
00:26:03,080 --> 00:26:06,920
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

186
00:26:14,510 --> 00:26:18,760
Goddamn creatures of the night,

187
00:26:20,470 --> 00:26:22,220

188
00:26:26,440 --> 00:26:30,820
"Suddenly I heard
a tapping, as if someone...

189

gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door. "

190

What are you talking about?

191

You heard me rapping, right?

192
00:26:41,950 --> 00:26:46,080
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fucking new door!

193

194

Gold.

195

You're looking for a coroner,
shit-for-brains.

196
00:26:59,600 --> 00:27:04,730
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

197
00:27:04,810 --> 00:27:07,350
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

198

- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

199

You're not paying attention.

200

No!

201

I repeat, a gold

202
00:27:30,170 --> 00:27:33,630
It was pawned here a year ago

203
00:27:36,340 --> 00:27:40,010
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

204
00:27:45,310 --> 00:27:47,310
Who's this sack of shit?

205

That's Tin Tin, one of

206

207

Don't any of your street demons

208

This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't

209
00:28:00,700 --> 00:28:05,410
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

210

I'm suppose to thank you

211
00:28:07,500 --> 00:28:11,250
Word to the wise:
Watch your fucking mouth.

212

213

214

215

216

- What are you doing?

217

- Don't you know this game?

218

Okay, the rings!

219

They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

220

Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

221

222

No, no.

223

No, no, no.

224

Oh, it's beautiful.

225

226

I love you.

227

- Take anything you want.

228

- Take anything!

229
00:29:47,930 --> 00:29:50,770
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

230

little party pals.

231

The Pit. They all

232
00:29:56,020 --> 00:30:01,110
T- birds's little potato-heads hang out

233

- Oh, baby, oh.

234

235

236

237

238

239

Don't kill me.

240

241

242

243

244

they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

245
00:30:50,870 --> 00:30:54,500
You're nothing but street grease,

246

247
00:30:56,790 --> 00:30:59,750
No, man, no!
No!

248
00:30:59,790 --> 00:31:03,260
No!

249
00:31:18,940 --> 00:31:22,400
It's on the house, kiddo,
you know that.

250
00:31:22,480 --> 00:31:24,780
One root beer.

251
00:31:26,780 --> 00:31:29,530
I can't do anything.

252
00:31:29,620 --> 00:31:34,080
Your mom... technically,
she's off right now.

253
00:31:34,160 --> 00:31:36,290
Yeah, way off.

254
00:31:40,880 --> 00:31:45,800
Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

255
00:31:45,840 --> 00:31:48,880
I thought the police
always said, "Freeze!"

256
00:31:48,970 --> 00:31:52,890
I am the police and I say don't move,
Snow White. You move, you're dead.

257
00:31:52,970 --> 00:31:58,140
And I say I'm dead and I move.

258
00:31:58,190 --> 00:32:01,520
Not one more step.
I'm serious.

259
00:32:01,560 --> 00:32:05,940
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

260
00:32:06,030 --> 00:32:09,160
What are you, nuts?
Walking into a gun?

261
00:32:09,240 --> 00:32:10,950
You high?

262
00:32:11,030 --> 00:32:14,200
- You don't remember me?
- What are you talking about?

263
00:32:14,290 --> 00:32:18,290
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

264
00:32:18,370 --> 00:32:21,040
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

265
00:32:21,080 --> 00:32:25,710
I want you to move over to the curb,
nice and easy. Move it!

266
00:32:25,760 --> 00:32:30,590
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

267
00:32:30,680 --> 00:32:35,140
- It's getting too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

268
00:32:35,220 --> 00:32:37,640
Do you know someone named T-bird?

269
00:32:37,730 --> 00:32:42,310
He had a friend who shouldn't have
played with knives. Like the coat?

270
00:32:42,400 --> 00:32:44,980
You're the guy
that murdered Tin Tin.

271
00:32:45,070 --> 00:32:48,570
- Check it out.
- He was already dead.

272
00:32:48,650 --> 00:32:53,990
- He died a year ago.
The moment he touched her.

273
00:32:54,080 --> 00:32:57,750
They're all dead.
They just don't know it yet.

274
00:32:57,830 --> 00:33:00,250
Get away from there!

275
00:33:00,330 --> 00:33:03,460
Cops!
Get outta here!

276
00:33:03,500 --> 00:33:06,920
Leave it, run!

277
00:33:12,300 --> 00:33:16,640
Oh, great, great.

278
00:33:16,720 --> 00:33:19,310
Guy shows up looking like
a mime from hell...

279
00:33:19,390 --> 00:33:21,690
and you lose him
right out in the open.

280
00:33:21,770 --> 00:33:27,610
Well, at least he didn't do that walking
against the wind shit. I hate that.

281
00:33:27,690 --> 00:33:31,610
Little early
for Devil's Night.

282
00:33:33,200 --> 00:33:35,910
You are very restless.

283
00:33:35,990 --> 00:33:39,200
Just wish I was a little
hungry again, that's all.

284
00:33:39,290 --> 00:33:43,540
- Be careful of what you ask for.
- Yeah, I may get it, I know.

285
00:33:55,010 --> 00:33:58,060
There are energies
aligning against you.

286
00:33:58,140 --> 00:34:00,600
Seeing is believing,
isn't it?

287
00:34:11,400 --> 00:34:14,410
Mmm, yummy.

288
00:34:19,740 --> 00:34:23,710
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down
to the foundation.

289
00:34:23,790 --> 00:34:27,000
Nobody cleared
this little event with me.

290
00:34:27,080 --> 00:34:28,840
I didn't have nothing
to do with that.

291
00:34:28,920 --> 00:34:31,590
You must be
awfully disappointed.

292
00:34:31,670 --> 00:34:35,010
I got trouble.
One of my crew got himself perished.

293
00:34:35,050 --> 00:34:37,350
- Yeah, who might that be?
- Tin Tin.

294
00:34:37,430 --> 00:34:42,020
Somebody stuck his blades in all his
major organs in alphabetical order.

295
00:34:42,060 --> 00:34:44,640
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

296
00:34:44,730 --> 00:34:47,900

for poor, old Tin Tin.

297
00:34:50,570 --> 00:34:53,150
You're working for me
tomorrow night, right?

298
00:34:53,240 --> 00:34:56,030
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

299
00:34:56,070 --> 00:34:58,910
That's very reassuring.

300
00:34:58,950 --> 00:35:03,000
I still ain't heard
why Gideon's burned down.

301
00:35:03,080 --> 00:35:07,540
Is that a natural catastrophe
or act of God or something?

302
00:35:07,630 --> 00:35:09,460
Call it my need to know.

303
00:35:43,080 --> 00:35:45,660
Let go, you creep!

304
00:35:49,000 --> 00:35:50,750
Nah.

305
00:35:50,840 --> 00:35:54,130
You didn't even slow down,
you dickhead!

306
00:35:55,550 --> 00:35:57,930
He couldn't have stopped.

307
00:35:58,010 --> 00:36:02,300
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

308
00:36:02,390 --> 00:36:05,430
What are you supposed to be,
a clown or something?

309
00:36:05,520 --> 00:36:07,520
Sometimes.

310
00:36:09,560 --> 00:36:14,320
It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

311
00:36:15,480 --> 00:36:18,990
- It can't rain all the time.
- Eric?

312
00:36:35,920 --> 00:36:40,510
Don't thank me.
Are we fighting the good fight?

313
00:36:40,590 --> 00:36:44,930
Double homicide a year ago.
No convictions.

314
00:36:45,010 --> 00:36:48,430
Annie... look at that.

315
00:36:48,520 --> 00:36:52,730
"We, the undersigned tenants of
1929 Caulderon Court Apartments... "

316
00:36:52,810 --> 00:36:54,860
What is this, a petition?

317
00:36:54,940 --> 00:36:57,820
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

318
00:36:57,900 --> 00:37:01,990
- The cause got her killed.
- She was fighting tenant eviction in that neighborhood?

319
00:37:02,070 --> 00:37:07,950
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

320
00:37:08,040 --> 00:37:11,580
The last time you snooped around a case
is when you got put back on the beat.

321
00:37:11,670 --> 00:37:15,670
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me.
- I bet he does.

322
00:37:22,680 --> 00:37:26,430
You're going to wind up
working a school crosswalk.

323
00:37:26,470 --> 00:37:28,600
I'm cool.

324
00:37:28,680 --> 00:37:33,440
You didn't get that file from me, okay?
And don't tell me you owe me one.

325
00:37:33,480 --> 00:37:35,980
Ah, I owe you one!

326
00:37:36,070 --> 00:37:38,110
Yeah, right.

327
00:37:38,150 --> 00:37:40,320
Damn.

328
00:38:05,760 --> 00:38:09,640
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

329
00:38:09,720 --> 00:38:13,390
and watch this whole fucking city
burn from that window.

330
00:38:38,290 --> 00:38:40,920
- There's a big fucking bird over there.

331
00:38:40,960 --> 00:38:42,970
Huh?

332
00:38:44,130 --> 00:38:47,010
It's a squab.

333
00:38:47,090 --> 00:38:49,720
Come here, bird.

334
00:38:49,810 --> 00:38:51,890
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

335
00:38:51,970 --> 00:38:54,310
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

336
00:38:54,350 --> 00:38:56,980
Here, birdie, birdie.

337
00:38:57,020 --> 00:39:00,020
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

338
00:39:02,650 --> 00:39:05,860
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

339
00:39:05,950 --> 00:39:08,530
Here, Funboy.

340
00:39:10,870 --> 00:39:12,830
What the fuck?

341
00:39:19,210 --> 00:39:23,760
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly

342
00:39:23,840 --> 00:39:26,010
Look at him.

343
00:39:26,050 --> 00:39:28,930
Don't sweat it.

344
00:39:30,640 --> 00:39:33,680
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

345
00:39:41,610 --> 00:39:46,450
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

346
00:39:48,450 --> 00:39:53,370
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

347
00:39:53,450 --> 00:39:56,960
You need professional help.

348
00:39:58,750 --> 00:40:01,340
Bingo!

349
00:40:01,420 --> 00:40:04,050
He shoots! He scores!

350
00:40:14,180 --> 00:40:17,890
- Jesus Christ!
- Jesus Christ?

351
00:40:17,980 --> 00:40:20,690
Stop me if you heard this one.

352
00:40:20,770 --> 00:40:23,690
Jesus Christ

353
00:40:25,780 --> 00:40:27,570
Ow.

354
00:40:29,110 --> 00:40:31,870
He hands the innkeeper
three nails and he asks...

355
00:40:31,950 --> 00:40:35,490
Don't you ever fucking die?

356
00:40:35,580 --> 00:40:37,830
"Can you put me up for the night?"

357
00:40:43,340 --> 00:40:47,920
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it... Fuck, does it hurt?

358
00:40:48,010 --> 00:40:50,050
Oh, God.

359

Look what you've done

360

361
00:41:23,500 --> 00:41:26,210

362
00:41:43,980 --> 00:41:47,860
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

363
00:41:55,700 --> 00:41:59,540

364
00:41:59,580 --> 00:42:04,080
Mother is the name for God

365
00:42:04,170 --> 00:42:08,920

Morphine is bad for you.

366

367
00:42:53,920 --> 00:42:57,600
If I wanted ice,

368
00:42:57,680 --> 00:42:59,930
Now fill it up!

369
00:43:01,020 --> 00:43:04,390
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

370
00:43:04,480 --> 00:43:07,150

371
00:43:13,690 --> 00:43:15,700
All right.

372
00:43:15,740 --> 00:43:19,700
You burn yourself

373
00:43:19,740 --> 00:43:22,330
- Fuck off.
- You have an appointment.

374
00:43:22,410 --> 00:43:24,870
- Well, shit on me.
- Drink up.

375
00:43:24,960 --> 00:43:27,880

Do I bow or do I curtsy?

376
00:43:27,960 --> 00:43:30,750
Get my friend here

377
00:43:30,840 --> 00:43:34,260
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

378
00:43:34,340 --> 00:43:37,260
Hey, good night, Darla.

379
00:43:39,680 --> 00:43:43,390
You stay put right there.

380
00:43:51,440 --> 00:43:54,900
Get away, steamhead.

381
00:44:14,170 --> 00:44:16,130
Shh.

382
00:44:26,060 --> 00:44:31,810
As you can see, I'm
on the corner of 27th and Washington...

383
00:44:31,860 --> 00:44:34,610
- the site of last year's biggest

384
00:44:34,690 --> 00:44:37,650
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

385
00:44:37,740 --> 00:44:40,700

was totally demolished by fire.

386
00:44:40,740 --> 00:44:42,910
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

387
00:44:42,990 --> 00:44:45,120
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

388
00:44:45,200 --> 00:44:49,960
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police...

389
00:44:50,040 --> 00:44:52,960
Freeze!

390
00:44:53,040 --> 00:44:56,550
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

391
00:44:56,590 --> 00:44:58,590
Fuck.

392
00:45:00,550 --> 00:45:02,720
Good likeness.

393
00:45:02,800 --> 00:45:06,520
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

394
00:45:06,600 --> 00:45:08,850
You still have your hat on.

395
00:45:12,770 --> 00:45:14,860
I gotta sit down.

396
00:45:15,650 --> 00:45:17,610
Shi...

397
00:45:17,650 --> 00:45:20,530
Holy Shit.

398
00:45:21,990 --> 00:45:24,620
Say...

399
00:45:24,700 --> 00:45:29,000
are you some kind of... ghost?

400
00:45:29,080 --> 00:45:31,040
Boo!

401
00:45:38,630 --> 00:45:43,180
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

402
00:45:45,180 --> 00:45:49,270
You took a six-story swan dive

403
00:45:49,350 --> 00:45:52,440
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

404
00:45:52,520 --> 00:45:57,110
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

405
00:45:57,190 --> 00:45:59,820
Come on. Read the file.

406
00:45:59,900 --> 00:46:04,240
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

407
00:46:04,320 --> 00:46:07,540
Her body finally just gave it up.

408
00:46:07,580 --> 00:46:11,460
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

409
00:46:21,340 --> 00:46:23,260
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

410
00:46:23,340 --> 00:46:27,350
Hey.

411
00:46:28,760 --> 00:46:31,600
You okay?

412
00:46:31,640 --> 00:46:34,350
I saw her.

413
00:46:35,980 --> 00:46:39,280
I saw her
through your eyes.

414
00:46:39,360 --> 00:46:41,440
You stayed with her
the whole time.

415
00:46:41,530 --> 00:46:46,990
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

416
00:46:47,070 --> 00:46:51,830
I was hoping
she'd come out of it, you know.

417
00:46:51,870 --> 00:46:54,830
Give me something
I could work with.

418
00:46:54,870 --> 00:46:57,130
Yeah.

419
00:46:57,170 --> 00:46:59,630
Look, I...

420
00:46:59,670 --> 00:47:02,170
Why didn't you do
something about it?

421
00:47:02,260 --> 00:47:05,590
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

422
00:47:05,680 --> 00:47:09,140
would talk after
what happened to you?

423
00:47:09,220 --> 00:47:12,430
I kept asking
questions and...

424
00:47:12,520 --> 00:47:15,190

my nose where it wasn't wanted.

425
00:47:19,190 --> 00:47:21,150
This your wife?

426
00:47:21,230 --> 00:47:25,700
Yeah, we, uh... Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

427
00:47:27,570 --> 00:47:30,530
It's funny.

428
00:47:30,580 --> 00:47:34,580
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

429
00:47:34,660 --> 00:47:38,170
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

430
00:47:38,250 --> 00:47:41,250
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

431
00:47:50,890 --> 00:47:55,350
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

432
00:48:00,020 --> 00:48:03,230
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

433

I thought I'd use
your front door.

434
00:48:12,620 --> 00:48:18,460
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what

435
00:48:20,000 --> 00:48:22,340
Yeah.

436
00:48:26,880 --> 00:48:29,470
Yeah.

437
00:48:29,550 --> 00:48:33,060
I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

438
00:48:33,140 --> 00:48:36,270
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

439
00:48:36,350 --> 00:48:39,400
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

440
00:48:39,480 --> 00:48:42,730
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

441
00:48:42,770 --> 00:48:45,320
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

442
00:48:45,400 --> 00:48:49,820
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

443
00:48:49,910 --> 00:48:54,910
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

444
00:48:54,990 --> 00:48:57,460
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

445
00:48:57,540 --> 00:49:00,040
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

446
00:49:00,120 --> 00:49:05,630
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

447
00:49:05,710 --> 00:49:08,470
You ain't lost everything.

448
00:49:08,550 --> 00:49:13,640
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

449
00:49:13,720 --> 00:49:17,310
Fair enough. Catch.

450
00:49:18,430 --> 00:49:20,850
Aah! Jesus.

451
00:49:20,940 --> 00:49:23,360
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

452
00:49:23,440 --> 00:49:25,440
What're you telling me,
this thing is real?

453
00:49:25,480 --> 00:49:29,150
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

454
00:49:29,240 --> 00:49:33,200
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

455
00:49:33,280 --> 00:49:37,410
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

456
00:49:37,500 --> 00:49:40,160
Yeah.

457
00:49:40,210 --> 00:49:45,380
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

458
00:49:45,460 --> 00:49:48,710
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister?

459
00:49:48,757 --> 00:49:51,892
My father's daughter.
That's right.

460
00:49:51,927 --> 00:49:55,097
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

461
00:49:55,177 --> 00:49:57,427
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

462
00:49:57,517 --> 00:50:01,017
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

463
00:50:01,147 --> 00:50:04,607
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

464
00:50:04,687 --> 00:50:08,067
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

465
00:50:08,147 --> 00:50:10,407
Whatever the fuck that means.

466
00:50:10,447 --> 00:50:14,237
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

467
00:50:15,327 --> 00:50:17,407
Want to relax
that thing now?

468
00:50:17,447 --> 00:50:22,127
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

469
00:50:22,207 --> 00:50:26,587
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

470
00:50:26,627 --> 00:50:29,337
I ain't making all this up.

471
00:50:29,417 --> 00:50:33,927
I ain't twisted
like you two fucks.

472
00:50:35,717 --> 00:50:37,847
All right.

473
00:50:42,517 --> 00:50:47,527
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

474
00:50:47,607 --> 00:50:51,277
Yeah.

475
00:50:57,787 --> 00:51:00,787
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

476
00:51:07,707 --> 00:51:10,047
Thanks.

477
00:51:10,087 --> 00:51:12,377
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

478
00:51:12,467 --> 00:51:15,047
A big one.

479
00:51:15,137 --> 00:51:20,017
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

480
00:51:20,097 --> 00:51:24,017
I'll have the janitor
come on up.

481
00:52:25,587 --> 00:52:27,837
You again.

482
00:52:27,927 --> 00:52:30,297
You lost or hungry?

483
00:52:30,347 --> 00:52:33,177
Hi.

484
00:52:51,117 --> 00:52:53,827
I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

485
00:52:53,907 --> 00:52:56,827
One part falls, it all falls!

486
00:52:56,907 --> 00:53:00,377
- You know how long it took us to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

487
00:53:00,417 --> 00:53:02,997
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fucking voodoo doll!

488
00:53:03,087 --> 00:53:05,167
Tin Tin was a dick.

489
00:53:05,257 --> 00:53:08,217
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

490
00:53:08,297 --> 00:53:12,507
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

491
00:53:12,597 --> 00:53:14,507
Fire it up!

492
00:53:17,097 --> 00:53:19,187
No Funboy.

493
00:53:19,267 --> 00:53:23,187
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

494
00:53:28,567 --> 00:53:31,657
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

495
00:53:31,737 --> 00:53:33,737
I'm on it.

496
00:54:04,397 --> 00:54:07,977
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

497
00:54:08,067 --> 00:54:12,697
I'm your passenger.

498
00:54:19,577 --> 00:54:21,747
Drive.

499
00:54:26,837 --> 00:54:28,627
What's all this
happy horseshit?

500
00:54:28,707 --> 00:54:30,837
Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

501
00:54:36,257 --> 00:54:39,517
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

502
00:54:39,597 --> 00:54:43,597
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

503
00:54:50,567 --> 00:54:54,987
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

504
00:54:56,617 --> 00:54:59,487
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

505
00:54:59,577 --> 00:55:02,657
- This is business, right?
- Faster.

506
00:55:05,627 --> 00:55:09,837
You got that cream stuff?

507
00:55:09,877 --> 00:55:12,297
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

508
00:55:13,877 --> 00:55:16,887
What in the crap...

509
00:55:20,387 --> 00:55:23,227
Oh, look. Making us popular.

510
00:55:23,267 --> 00:55:25,977
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

511
00:55:31,567 --> 00:55:34,527
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

512
00:55:37,067 --> 00:55:39,237
Turn.

513
00:55:40,577 --> 00:55:43,327
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

514
00:55:43,407 --> 00:55:47,747
Right? Huh?

515
00:55:49,287 --> 00:55:51,797
Damn! Dead end!

516
00:55:57,177 --> 00:55:59,637
Look out!

517
00:56:02,967 --> 00:56:05,187
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

518
00:56:16,277 --> 00:56:20,527
Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

519
00:56:24,197 --> 00:56:26,707
Shit! Shit!

520
00:56:33,837 --> 00:56:37,547
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

521
00:56:38,967 --> 00:56:42,427
T- bird!
I got you, man!

522
00:56:42,507 --> 00:56:44,887
Shit!

523
00:56:58,277 --> 00:57:00,567
Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

524
00:57:00,657 --> 00:57:03,907
But I don't know what...
What? Huh? What?

525
00:57:03,947 --> 00:57:06,747
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

526
00:57:06,787 --> 00:57:09,917
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

527
00:57:09,957 --> 00:57:12,127
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

528
00:57:12,207 --> 00:57:15,457
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

529
00:57:15,547 --> 00:57:19,127
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

530
00:57:19,217 --> 00:57:22,637
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

531
00:57:22,717 --> 00:57:25,967
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

532
00:57:26,057 --> 00:57:30,977
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

533
00:57:32,557 --> 00:57:34,437
Did you send us
these complaints?

534
00:57:36,147 --> 00:57:39,487
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood. "

535
00:57:39,527 --> 00:57:41,907
Does it get you sweaty?

536
00:57:41,987 --> 00:57:47,197
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

537
00:57:47,247 --> 00:57:51,327
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

538
00:57:51,497 --> 00:57:55,417
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

539
00:57:55,497 --> 00:57:58,967
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

540
00:57:59,007 --> 00:58:01,377
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

541
00:58:01,467 --> 00:58:05,927
T- bird...

542
00:58:06,007 --> 00:58:08,977
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

543
00:58:11,517 --> 00:58:15,687
T- bird.

544
00:58:15,767 --> 00:58:19,147
"Abashed the devil stood...

545
00:58:19,187 --> 00:58:22,157
and felt how awful goodness is. "

546
00:58:22,237 --> 00:58:25,117
"And felt how awful goodness is. "

547
00:58:39,167 --> 00:58:41,757
T- bird. T-bird.

548
00:59:32,137 --> 00:59:34,437
This is the 7:00 a. m. edition
of Action News.

549
00:59:34,517 --> 00:59:36,857
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

550
00:59:36,897 --> 00:59:41,277
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

551
00:59:41,357 --> 00:59:44,777
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

552
00:59:44,857 --> 00:59:50,237
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

553
00:59:50,287 --> 00:59:55,457
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

554
00:59:55,537 --> 00:59:59,167
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties...

555
00:59:59,247 --> 01:00:03,047
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

556
01:00:05,087 --> 01:00:07,797
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

557
01:00:07,887 --> 01:00:12,807
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

558
01:00:12,887 --> 01:00:17,017
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

559
01:00:17,097 --> 01:00:20,437
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

560
01:00:20,477 --> 01:00:25,607
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

561
01:00:25,647 --> 01:00:31,447
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

562
01:00:31,487 --> 01:00:36,747
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

563
01:00:39,247 --> 01:00:43,547
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

564
01:00:43,627 --> 01:00:45,837
Over easy.

565
01:00:47,927 --> 01:00:52,637
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

566
01:01:03,227 --> 01:01:05,487
Hey, Albrecht.

567
01:01:08,237 --> 01:01:11,157
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

568
01:01:11,237 --> 01:01:14,487
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

569
01:01:14,577 --> 01:01:18,787
- We're gonna have to I.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

570
01:01:18,867 --> 01:01:20,787
Arson was his specialty.

571
01:01:20,877 --> 01:01:22,837
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

572
01:01:22,917 --> 01:01:26,837
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'- shit.

573
01:01:26,917 --> 01:01:29,177
Come here.

574
01:01:32,927 --> 01:01:34,887
You're holding out on me.

575
01:01:34,967 --> 01:01:38,517
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

576
01:01:38,597 --> 01:01:41,857
and you're covering up
for somebody.

577
01:01:41,937 --> 01:01:44,357
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

578
01:01:44,437 --> 01:01:48,317
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

579
01:01:48,397 --> 01:01:50,527
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

580
01:01:50,607 --> 01:01:53,487
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

581
01:01:53,527 --> 01:01:56,487
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

582
01:01:56,577 --> 01:01:58,497
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

583
01:01:58,577 --> 01:02:00,867
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

584
01:02:00,957 --> 01:02:02,957
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

585
01:02:03,037 --> 01:02:05,037
You gotta write that shit down.

586
01:02:05,087 --> 01:02:07,047
All right, smart-ass.

587
01:02:07,087 --> 01:02:10,177
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

588
01:02:10,217 --> 01:02:14,177
- Welcome to the first day of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

589
01:02:14,217 --> 01:02:17,967
- For what?
- Misconduct.

590
01:02:18,057 --> 01:02:22,057
Yeah, give me the lab.

591
01:03:12,817 --> 01:03:15,407
One for sorrow,
two for joy...

592
01:03:15,487 --> 01:03:18,327
- Come here.
- ... three for a girl, four for a boy.

593
01:03:23,367 --> 01:03:27,167
Dancing...

594
01:03:58,277 --> 01:04:00,237
Eric?

595
01:04:02,947 --> 01:04:07,247
Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

596
01:04:07,287 --> 01:04:10,247
Gabriel.

597
01:04:10,297 --> 01:04:13,087
I thought you were dead.

598
01:04:13,127 --> 01:04:16,427
You're not dead, are you?

599
01:04:41,197 --> 01:04:44,117
I knew it was you.

600
01:04:46,037 --> 01:04:48,957
Even with the makeup.

601
01:04:53,797 --> 01:04:56,377
I remembered your song.

602
01:04:56,467 --> 01:05:00,217
You said,
"Can't rain all the time. "

603
01:05:00,297 --> 01:05:03,557
That is from your song, right?

604
01:05:13,477 --> 01:05:16,607
Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

605
01:05:18,987 --> 01:05:23,077
I miss you...
and Shelly.

606
01:05:26,157 --> 01:05:29,617
Get so lonely
all by myself.

607
01:05:31,457 --> 01:05:36,087
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

608
01:05:36,167 --> 01:05:39,297
Sarah, I do care.

609
01:05:50,517 --> 01:05:52,647
That's him.
That's him!

610
01:05:52,727 --> 01:05:56,067
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

611
01:05:56,147 --> 01:05:59,397
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

612
01:05:59,487 --> 01:06:02,027
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

613
01:06:02,117 --> 01:06:04,907
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

614
01:06:04,987 --> 01:06:08,497
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

615
01:06:08,577 --> 01:06:12,497
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

616
01:06:13,837 --> 01:06:18,417
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

617
01:06:18,507 --> 01:06:21,087
- Empty.
- Fire it...

618
01:06:21,177 --> 01:06:23,087
Grave?
What grave?

619
01:06:23,177 --> 01:06:25,387
What about
my fucking grave?

620
01:06:25,467 --> 01:06:26,807
Three out of four.

621
01:06:26,887 --> 01:06:30,137
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

622
01:06:30,227 --> 01:06:32,847
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

623
01:06:32,937 --> 01:06:36,107
That boy was out of control.
T- bird, he came in, he says...

624
01:06:36,187 --> 01:06:39,487
..."Waste them both. " And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

625
01:06:43,527 --> 01:06:46,617
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

626
01:06:46,697 --> 01:06:50,457
- This ghost gonna kill...
- Hey.

627
01:06:50,537 --> 01:06:52,497
That ain't no ghost.

628
01:06:54,417 --> 01:06:57,587
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

629
01:06:57,627 --> 01:06:59,627
We might need him.

630
01:07:01,127 --> 01:07:03,587
Ghost gonna kill my...

631
01:07:16,307 --> 01:07:20,277
He like his plain
or with onions?

632
01:07:20,317 --> 01:07:23,777
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

633
01:07:23,817 --> 01:07:27,947
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

634
01:07:27,987 --> 01:07:30,617
That's what I thought.

635
01:07:30,657 --> 01:07:33,457
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

636
01:07:33,497 --> 01:07:35,787
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

637
01:07:35,827 --> 01:07:39,457
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

638
01:07:39,547 --> 01:07:44,877
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

639
01:07:44,967 --> 01:07:48,467
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

640
01:07:48,557 --> 01:07:51,467
Eric didn't come back for me.

641
01:07:51,557 --> 01:07:56,307
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

642
01:07:56,397 --> 01:07:59,567
You want a friend
to walk you home?

643
01:09:33,697 --> 01:09:36,617
Boys.

644
01:09:36,697 --> 01:09:40,117
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

645
01:09:40,207 --> 01:09:42,287
on account of
a slight case of death.

646
01:09:42,377 --> 01:09:44,337
You wanna sit down?

647
01:09:44,417 --> 01:09:49,797
Well, well, well.

648
01:09:49,837 --> 01:09:52,927
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

649
01:09:52,967 --> 01:09:54,927
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

650
01:09:54,967 --> 01:09:58,267
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

651
01:09:58,307 --> 01:10:00,557
I like the pretty lights.

652
01:10:03,567 --> 01:10:07,487
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

653
01:10:07,527 --> 01:10:12,737
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

654
01:10:12,817 --> 01:10:15,197
Only reason to quit.

655
01:10:15,287 --> 01:10:20,787
A man has an idea.

656
01:10:20,867 --> 01:10:23,127
The idea attracts others...

657
01:10:23,207 --> 01:10:25,297
like-minded.

658
01:10:25,377 --> 01:10:27,457
The idea expands.

659
01:10:27,547 --> 01:10:31,177
The idea becomes
an institution.

660
01:10:31,257 --> 01:10:33,927
What was the idea?

661
01:10:34,007 --> 01:10:37,767
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

662
01:10:37,847 --> 01:10:40,637
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

663
01:10:40,727 --> 01:10:43,807
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

664
01:10:43,897 --> 01:10:46,067
You see, gentlemen...

665
01:10:46,147 --> 01:10:51,147
greed is for amateurs.

666
01:10:51,237 --> 01:10:56,407
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

667
01:10:56,487 --> 01:10:59,077
now that's fun!

668
01:10:59,157 --> 01:11:01,457
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

669
01:11:01,537 --> 01:11:04,957
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

670
01:11:04,997 --> 01:11:08,087
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

671
01:11:08,167 --> 01:11:11,627
Do you know
what they got now?

672
01:11:11,667 --> 01:11:15,967
Devil's Night greeting cards.

673
01:11:16,007 --> 01:11:18,967
Isn't that precious?

674
01:11:19,017 --> 01:11:21,137
Yeah.

675
01:11:21,177 --> 01:11:25,977
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

676
01:11:26,017 --> 01:11:28,067
Time to move along.

677
01:11:28,147 --> 01:11:30,567
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

678
01:11:30,647 --> 01:11:33,147
No.

679
01:11:33,197 --> 01:11:35,817
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

680
01:11:35,867 --> 01:11:38,987
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

681
01:11:39,037 --> 01:11:41,657
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

682
01:11:41,697 --> 01:11:46,167
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

683
01:11:46,207 --> 01:11:48,337
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

684
01:11:48,377 --> 01:11:50,337
Skank!
You don't feel that?

685
01:11:50,377 --> 01:11:53,717
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.

686
01:11:53,757 --> 01:11:56,177
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook. "

687
01:11:56,257 --> 01:12:00,637
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

688
01:12:03,097 --> 01:12:05,727
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

689
01:12:07,147 --> 01:12:09,647
Gentlemen.

690
01:12:09,727 --> 01:12:14,357
Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

691
01:12:18,907 --> 01:12:22,697
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

692
01:12:22,747 --> 01:12:25,247
The killer of killers.

693
01:12:25,327 --> 01:12:28,167
Nice outfit.

694
01:12:28,247 --> 01:12:30,297
I'm not sure
about the face though.

695
01:12:30,377 --> 01:12:32,417
I just want him.

696
01:12:32,507 --> 01:12:35,927
Well, you can't have him.

697
01:12:36,007 --> 01:12:38,677
Well...

698
01:12:40,757 --> 01:12:43,217
I see you have
made your decision.

699
01:12:44,807 --> 01:12:46,767
Now let's see you enforce it.

700
01:12:46,847 --> 01:12:50,517
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

701
01:12:56,397 --> 01:13:00,327
Ooh, that had to hurt.

702
01:13:00,407 --> 01:13:03,197
Well, that's that.

703
01:13:03,287 --> 01:13:06,457
That guy was crazy.

704
01:13:13,087 --> 01:13:14,877
He's gone.

705
01:13:22,927 --> 01:13:24,637
Get him!

706
01:13:41,907 --> 01:13:44,697
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

707
01:13:48,747 --> 01:13:50,747
Jesus Christ!

708
01:14:07,177 --> 01:14:09,137
Hey!

709
01:14:41,677 --> 01:14:44,007
You're all going to die.

710
01:14:59,027 --> 01:15:01,857
Get the fuck outta here!

711
01:15:37,647 --> 01:15:40,567
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

712
01:15:40,647 --> 01:15:43,857
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

713
01:15:43,947 --> 01:15:47,827
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

714
01:15:47,907 --> 01:15:49,697
No!

715
01:15:54,327 --> 01:15:57,997
What in the crap...

716
01:15:59,337 --> 01:16:01,967
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

717
01:16:02,047 --> 01:16:05,467
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

718
01:16:14,557 --> 01:16:17,437
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

719
01:16:20,897 --> 01:16:24,527
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

720
01:16:24,607 --> 01:16:26,737
...arms and legs...

721
01:16:32,287 --> 01:16:37,077
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs...

722
01:17:17,707 --> 01:17:22,337
Come on! Move it!

723
01:17:26,757 --> 01:17:29,887
My advice:
Next time duck.

724
01:17:31,927 --> 01:17:34,307
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

725
01:17:37,767 --> 01:17:40,897
Shit!

726
01:17:43,777 --> 01:17:46,687
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

727
01:17:46,777 --> 01:17:49,237
Look at that out there.

728
01:17:49,277 --> 01:17:52,237
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

729
01:17:52,277 --> 01:17:55,497
Sky oughta be red.

730
01:17:55,577 --> 01:17:59,917
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

731
01:17:59,957 --> 01:18:05,667
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

732
01:18:05,757 --> 01:18:08,717
- I like him already.
- The crow...

733
01:18:08,797 --> 01:18:13,257
is his link between
the land of the living...

734
01:18:13,347 --> 01:18:15,677
and the realm of the dead.

735
01:18:15,767 --> 01:18:20,307
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

736
01:18:20,347 --> 01:18:22,357
Hmm.

737
01:18:45,457 --> 01:18:47,457
I'm coming home, Shelly.

738
01:19:36,547 --> 01:19:39,017
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

739
01:19:39,057 --> 01:19:41,137
in the middle
of the night, right?

740
01:19:41,177 --> 01:19:42,977
Safest place in the world to be.

741
01:19:43,017 --> 01:19:47,817
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

742
01:19:47,857 --> 01:19:52,027
It's really late, Sarah.

743
01:19:52,107 --> 01:19:54,857
You didn't say good-bye.

744
01:19:54,987 --> 01:19:58,947
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

745
01:19:59,037 --> 01:20:03,287
And you're never coming back.

746
01:20:09,587 --> 01:20:12,837
I gave this to Shelly once.

747
01:20:16,547 --> 01:20:19,507
I think she'd like you
to have it.

748
01:20:23,557 --> 01:20:25,847
This way you'll
always remember her.

749
01:20:25,897 --> 01:20:28,477
I'll never take it off.

750
01:20:46,617 --> 01:20:50,457
I better go sneak
back in the house.

751
01:20:56,587 --> 01:20:58,547
Bye.

752
01:21:18,527 --> 01:21:21,367
Shh! Shh!

753
01:21:23,287 --> 01:21:25,707
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

754
01:21:32,627 --> 01:21:35,087
Come on.
Come on.

755
01:21:48,387 --> 01:21:52,517
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

756
01:21:54,107 --> 01:21:57,237
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

757
01:22:03,657 --> 01:22:06,957
Her eyes are so innocent.

758
01:22:18,297 --> 01:22:20,257
Eric!

759
01:22:20,297 --> 01:22:24,257
Eric, help! Eric!

760
01:23:03,717 --> 01:23:06,927
Quick impression for ya.

761
01:23:07,017 --> 01:23:10,727
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

762
01:23:10,807 --> 01:23:14,147
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

763
01:23:14,227 --> 01:23:17,277
Well, well.

764
01:23:17,357 --> 01:23:21,107
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

765
01:23:29,077 --> 01:23:31,367
Nah. Fuck it.

766
01:23:39,837 --> 01:23:41,967
Aw, fuck.

767
01:23:49,217 --> 01:23:53,767
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

768
01:23:53,847 --> 01:23:57,687
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

769
01:24:02,027 --> 01:24:05,407
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

770
01:24:08,947 --> 01:24:11,197
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

771
01:24:12,867 --> 01:24:15,077
Bye-bye, birdie.

772
01:25:00,167 --> 01:25:02,297
Ah, shit.

773
01:25:02,337 --> 01:25:04,467
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

774
01:25:04,507 --> 01:25:06,547
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

775
01:25:06,627 --> 01:25:09,217
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

776
01:25:09,297 --> 01:25:11,307
Two more.

777
01:25:11,347 --> 01:25:13,347
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

778
01:25:13,427 --> 01:25:15,977
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

779
01:25:16,017 --> 01:25:18,807
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

780
01:25:18,857 --> 01:25:22,607
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

781
01:25:25,237 --> 01:25:28,777
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

782
01:25:28,867 --> 01:25:30,907
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

783
01:25:30,987 --> 01:25:34,447
I was.
I'm not anymore.

784
01:25:34,537 --> 01:25:38,747
Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

785
01:25:38,827 --> 01:25:41,747
Come on.

786
01:25:44,417 --> 01:25:46,467
You take that.

787
01:26:16,537 --> 01:26:19,997
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

788
01:26:44,107 --> 01:26:47,357
This is all the power
you ever had.

789
01:26:47,397 --> 01:26:49,527
Now it is mine.

790
01:26:49,567 --> 01:26:53,277
Pity there's not more time...

791
01:26:53,367 --> 01:26:55,987
...for us.

792
01:27:14,137 --> 01:27:16,967
Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

793
01:27:19,097 --> 01:27:21,637
Let me go!

794
01:27:30,737 --> 01:27:34,277
Let her go!

795
01:27:34,317 --> 01:27:38,947
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

796
01:27:38,997 --> 01:27:40,997
All right.

797
01:27:41,077 --> 01:27:43,117
No!

798
01:28:29,547 --> 01:28:31,007
Eric!

799
01:28:49,607 --> 01:28:52,937
- Sarah?
- Look out!

800
01:28:56,527 --> 01:29:00,027
Eric!

801
01:29:08,037 --> 01:29:10,207
You know,
my daddy used to say...

802
01:29:10,297 --> 01:29:12,797
"Every man's got a devil...

803
01:29:12,877 --> 01:29:15,007
and you can't rest
till you find him. "

804
01:29:15,087 --> 01:29:17,637
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend...

805
01:29:17,717 --> 01:29:20,637
I cleared that building.

806
01:29:20,717 --> 01:29:23,977
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

807
01:29:24,057 --> 01:29:26,897
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

808
01:29:26,977 --> 01:29:29,807
But if it's any consolation
to you...

809
01:29:29,897 --> 01:29:33,527
you have put
a smile on my face.

810
01:29:33,607 --> 01:29:36,237
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

811
01:29:36,277 --> 01:29:38,907
I am going to miss you.

812
01:29:38,947 --> 01:29:41,487
I have something
to give you.

813
01:29:41,577 --> 01:29:43,947
I don't want it anymore.

814
01:29:48,457 --> 01:29:51,457
Thirty hours of pain!

815
01:29:53,797 --> 01:29:56,507
All at once!

816
01:29:56,587 --> 01:29:59,587
All for you.

817
01:30:25,197 --> 01:30:28,367
Yeah.

818
01:30:35,207 --> 01:30:38,047
Go help him.

819
01:30:41,387 --> 01:30:43,677
Are you alive?

820
01:30:45,677 --> 01:30:49,687
God, I need a cigarette.

821
01:30:55,647 --> 01:30:57,607
Everybody else dead?

822
01:30:57,647 --> 01:30:59,947
You helped me.

823
01:31:00,027 --> 01:31:02,567
What you kept in here
saved me.

824
01:31:02,657 --> 01:31:05,787
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

825
01:31:05,867 --> 01:31:08,867
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

826
01:31:13,877 --> 01:31:16,627
Oh, yuck.

827
01:31:16,707 --> 01:31:21,717
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

828
01:31:30,187 --> 01:31:33,647
Stay with him
until help comes.

829
01:31:33,687 --> 01:31:37,147
He'll be okay, right?

830
01:31:37,227 --> 01:31:39,437
Eric?

831
01:31:40,897 --> 01:31:44,487
He does that a lot.

832
01:32:00,757 --> 01:32:03,217
Shelly.

833
01:32:15,437 --> 01:32:20,277
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

834
01:32:20,357 --> 01:32:23,067
At least it stopped raining, huh?

835
01:32:23,107 --> 01:32:26,527
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

836
01:32:26,617 --> 01:32:29,947
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

837
01:32:29,987 --> 01:32:31,957
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

838
01:32:31,997 --> 01:32:36,577
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

839
01:32:36,667 --> 01:32:38,707
You missed it.

840
01:32:38,797 --> 01:32:41,457
Get him outta here!

841
01:33:45,647 --> 01:33:47,607
Thanks.

842
01:33:52,827 --> 01:33:55,867
If the people we love
are stolen from us...

843
01:33:55,957 --> 01:34:01,037
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

844
01:34:01,127 --> 01:34:07,007
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
